Reviews.Title: Fantastic Tablet
Reviews.Author: Jonathan
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely the best tablet available. I spent forever comparing specs and found this to be superior to apple and other androids. For American consumers like me At&t; has the needed micro Sims it was painless to setup. Just pop it in verify the number and copy (setup the same - i don't mean moving files) the AP configuration the same as other android tablets "att broad band ... etc" As much as the specs made sense seeing is definitely believing.  The Sony modifications to the base system including Walkman and FM Radio among other things are awesome. It is stunningly good looking. And takes great pictures and video.... I was concerned about not having a flash but it turned out not to be a big deal, low light level still took nice pictures. I have no complaints and highly recommend this tablet

Reviews.Title: Great tablet. Sturdy. 4g/Lte would not work.
Reviews.Author: Abhishek Verma
Reviews.Content: Placed an order for one, from the Sony Store. $616 with tax included.Tablet came. Opened it, everthing was working fine.Very sturdy, slots for charging are closed tightly with plastic tabs.4g/Lte never worked. Sim tray is slightly tricky to use too (see youtube video to figure out how to use it).My Nexus 7 tablet 4g/Lte was working smoothly.Returned it. Would stay away from Sony 3G/4G tablets.

Reviews.Title: Awesome as usual
Reviews.Author: Jillian Lasecki
Reviews.Content: The SIM card works perfectly, and I dont know what these other guys are talking about. Everything was perfect. I didnt like that they sent me an international charger but it works.

Reviews.Title: 4G/LTE does not work
Reviews.Author: shuba natarajan
Reviews.Content: Great Tablet. But disappointed. There is an issue with the 4G/LTE connectivity in these Sony Xperia tablets. I took it to AT&T;, they tried connectivity with 2 SIM cards. Sony tech support tried some software updates, AT&T; Tech support did some testing but nothing fixed the issue. I placed the order for during black friday sale from the Sony Store and I was surprised to hear from Sony that they will not replace the tablet, but they would refund my purchase and I would have to purchase a new one at current prices.I just saw an update from another customer who bought it in November 2013 who seemed to have the same issue. I wish I had read the review before placing my order.Raj

Reviews.Title: Best Android Tablet I Have Tried
Reviews.Author: Mike L.
Reviews.Content: I have purchased several Android tablets over the past few years.  The Sony tablet is by far, my favorite.  While the screen resolution isn't quite as good as the Nexus 10, the difference is minimal.  My Galaxy Note 10.1 & 8.0 can't hold a candle to the screen of the Sony.  The SD card expandability and 4G LTE radio were final deciding factors for me.  I'm an AT&T; customer and the SIM card popped in and started working with no issues.  The unit is very comfortable to hold for long periods of time because of it's minimal weight.  Batter life is quite good.  If you engage the Stamina Mode, the unit will last for days on a single charge.  The only minor criticism is about the hardness of the screen material.  I don't know what material Sony is using, but I've managed to put a few small scratches on the panel in a short amount of time.  My iPad and other tablets have gone much longer with hardly any signs of wear at all.  I don't like using screen protectors, but I may with the Sony.  I highly recommend the Tablet Z.
